wikipedia_page.main: Dame Lesley Regan  (born 8 March 1956) is a British gynaecologist, Professor and Head of Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology at Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust at St Mary's Hospital, and Deputy Head of the Division of Surgery, Oncology, Reproductive Biology and Anaesthetics at Imperial College London. She has been the president of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists since 2016.

response: * Prof. Dame Lesley Regan, DBE, gynaecologist

link_mentions.page: List of Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire
response: *2020: Caroline Allen, The Baroness Benjamin, Mary Berry, Muffy Calder, The Baroness Campbell of Loughborough, Siobhan Davies, Clare Gerada, Lynn Gladden, Teresa Graham, Gillian Guy, Victoria Heywood, Susan Hill, Elaine Inglesby-Burke, Diana Johnson, Donna Langley, Maureen Lipman, Olivia Newton-John, Magdalene Odundo, Caroline Palmer Yeates, Linda Pollard, Anne Marie Rafferty, Lesley Regan, Rose Tremain, Julia Unwin, Emma Walmsley, Sarah Whatmore, Sharon White, Sarah Worthington
The charity is based in London, and consists of: a team of staff and volunteers; a board of trustees headed up by Professor Dame Lesley Regan, and a Research Advisory Committee.

link_mentions.page: List of members of the National Academy of Medicine

response: * Professor Lesley Regan, President, Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists. For services to Women's Healthcare.
